entry.title: painted blind
entry.summary:
Author: IHadHimOnTheRopes (CarterReid)

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 64,503Chapters: 19/?Kudos: 3,382

Summary: When Clark's mother sat him down one late winter's evening to explain just how different he really was, he realised that his soulmate most likely lay in the stardust haloed around what was once his planet. In the end, that was just another thing that told him he was alone. When he met Lois, he began to believe that maybe he wouldn't be alone, because she was perfect. She was everything he could ever want. Then Bruce Wayne said his words.

entry.title: The Contract
entry.summary:
Author: imanaddictiveiguess

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,903Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 145

Summary: Eons upon eons have passed since Hadrian "Harry Potter" Black became Death's master. Now expertly wielding powers that preside over both death and magic throughout all of existence and his world now long gone; Hadrian after mourning his friend's and lost world eventually took Death's offer and stayed by their side balancing the cosmos. Now millennia afterwards Death saw it fit to drop him in a new reality where super heroes and villains exist often facing world ending disasters like every other Tuesday. His new duty is that he must help keep this universe from imploding on its self all while on "vacation". No big deal right?

entry.title: What is a Bat if not for his Two Wings?
entry.summary:
Author: acatcam

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 30,821Chapters: 23/?Kudos: 274

Summary: Bruce Wayne had spent years perfecting the art of being underestimated. The impulsive, table-dancing, ice-sculptor-grinding, billion-dollar himbo persona kept people from looking too closely — especially at Gotham’s other nocturnal resident.But with the Justice League newly formed, curiosity was brewing, and one caped Kryptonian in particular was determined to uncover the man behind the Bat. Clark Kent, investigative journalist and alien protector, was convinced Bruce Wayne’s friendship with Batman meant something more — maybe funding, maybe shared secrets. The problem? Bruce knew Clark’s game, and he was going to play it better. When a gala-turned-villain-attack forced Bruce to act in his Wayne persona and Superman swooped in to save him, the lines between charm and suspicion blurred. Bruce, ever the flirt, ran his hand over Superman’s bicep with a grin and purred, “You saved my life just for a question?”It was going to take more than x-ray vision to win this bet.When a simple bet turns to much more than two players hoped.

entry.title: Lavender Marriage
entry.summary:
Author: TheBobblehat

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 58,385Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 320

Summary: Lex Luthor has sponsored the new wing of the Metropolis Science Museum, and Clark and Bruce both suspect foul play. While in the geology exhibit, they discover an unknown strand of kryptonite, which cripples Clark almost immediately. Bruce drags him away, but just as they're catching their breath, a mysterious gunman fires on Clark from the shadows, piercing his heart with a bullet, specially made from Luthor's new find.Bruce gets Clark to a safe house and manages to extract the bullet, but not before saving Clark from its strange effects. When he wakes up, Clark recognizes Bruce. But not as his caped companion, or a fellow member of the League. They aren't competitors, allies, or even just friends.According to Clark, Bruce Wayne is his husband.

entry.title: Gotham is Burning.
entry.summary:
Author: istayniche

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 113,432Chapters: 36/36Kudos: 1,297

Summary: "Were you aware that LuthorCorp was using Wayne technology in their illegal weapons programs?" For the first time, Bruce looked genuinely surprised. "Those contracts were terminated." "When? Before or after Luthor's crimes became public?" Bruce was quiet for a long moment, his fingers drumming against the arm of his chair. "I'd have to check with our legal department about the specific timeline." "So you don't know?" Bruce was silent. Gotham's drowning, Batman's bleeding, and a nosy reporter won't stop asking why.Three years after the flood, a rot festers, born from the stragglers of Riddler's movement.The Sons of Gotham, neo-Nazis with mysteriously deep pockets, rise from the grime. Bruce bleeds for a city that keeps sinking.Enter Clark Kent: infuriatingly earnest, maddeningly handsome, and asking questions Bruce can't answer.When threats grow too big for one city, Batman reluctantly teams up with Superman. Saving Gotham wasn't hard.Letting someone help? Letting someone in? Easier said than done.

entry.title: The Buttered Cat Paradox
entry.summary:
Author: writersagainstwritersblock

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 57,721Chapters: 23/?Kudos: 786

Summary: “No comment.”“You don’t know what I was going to ask,” Clark said with a hint of a smile. “Maybe I just wanted to congratulate you on catching the Film Freak.”Bruce gave him a flat look.“Or maybe I think I can help.”“With a case of vandalism?”Clark stepped in front of him. “It’s not vandalism and you know it, detective.”“And what makes you say that?”“If it were vandalism it would be something a lot more juvenile. To the point. It wouldn’t claim there were seventeen missing kids. That’s public outcry.”“Is that so?”“That and I tried to do a story on the growing number of homeless children last month and I got shut down. According to the last count, the numbers have been decreasing, but there’s been no change in policies, no extra funding to CPS, or shelters, or even an increase in the number of inmates in the juvenile detention center. So where are they going?” Detective Bruce Wayne may have the highest solve rate in Gotham, but if he wants to solve this case, he’ll need the help of an elusive street kid, and while Dick Grayson always lands on his feet, he usually lands himself right into trouble.

entry.title: Anyone But You
entry.summary:
Author: ILoveArce

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,276Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 47

Summary: After a lovely romantic night, Clark and Bruce believe they have found love in each other. However, an unfortunate situation leaves them with a very bad impression of one another.Six months later, they meet again… and their interaction could not be worse. Now, with their best friends’ wedding coming up, they are forced to spend time together and avoid ruining the celebration with their obvious animosity. Even if that means pretending to be a couple.
